subject: Re: [junit] How can I set tests dynamical?
msgSnippet: If you are using ant the ant task helps lets you select which files to run. If you want something that works both in ant and in your IDE you can use rMock
messageBody:
If you are using ant the ant task helps lets you select which files to run.

If you want something that works both in ant and in your IDE you can use
rMock dynamic suites
http://rmock.sourceforge.net/dynamicsuites.html

There is also something in junit add-ons that does something similar to
dynamic suites.

The two latter alternatives are much faster in and if you are forking your
JVM for each test.
Hope this helps!
/Joakim Ohlrogge
